title: `attempted .def_id() on invalid res: Err` in rustdoc for `pub(restricted)` struct fields using derive helper macros

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
Originally from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/64705#issuecomment-558242120 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/64705#issuecomment-561263210.

Reduced down to

`Cargo.toml`:

```toml
[package]
name = "repro-ironoxide"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2018"

[dependencies]
serde = { version = "~1.0", features = ["derive"] }
```

`lib.rs`:

```rust
mod internal {
    use serde::Serialize;
    #[derive(Serialize)]
    pub struct GroupAdmin {
        #[serde(flatten)]
        pub(in crate::internal) encrypted_msg: (),
    }
}
```

<details><summary>backtrace</summary>

```

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not document `repro-ironoxide`.
```

</details>

This bisects to 5c5b8afd80e6fa1d24632153cb2257c686041d41 namely #64694 (cc. @petrochenkov). This may have the same root cause as #64705 because again we're seeing a `Def::Err` in the path for `pub(in crate::internal)`.
